content: easy crochet raglan top beginner friendly easy to make this crochet project is worked top-down in one piece with the raglan method © copyright jeannalicce 2025 - jeannalicce - ko-fi jeannalicce measurements i made this pattern according to my own size which is medium i also provide in the following pattern some other alternatives to fit sizes xs/s/m/l/xl/xxl always written in that order in the pattern yarn 2 skeins of viking garn - raggen - shade nr 752 150g/ 225 m this yarn consists of 70% superwash wool from south america - 30% nylon i recommend following this pattern while using a similar type of yarn see here for yarn alternatives tips https //yarnsub com/yarns/viking_of_norway/raggen abbreviations chain chain slip_stitch slipped stitch yo yearn over double_crochet double_crochet treble_crochet treble_crochet chain space chain space material 2-3 skeins of the yarn of your choice and depending on the size of the top you want to make i used 328 yds/ 300 m so 7 oz/ 200 g crochet hook of your choice i used 6 mm/ j-10 scissors 4 stitch markers sewing tape yarn needle notes before beginning the bigger the hook you use in comparison to the yarn s thickness the looser your project will be - and vice versa the combo of stitches that i used can of course be replaced whether you prefer a less or more see-through top © copyright jeannalicce 2025 pattern the yoke base with increases chain 54 60 66 72 78 84 and flatten the chain it is very important not to twist the chain while you join both sides slip_stitch to join both sides row 1 chain 2 and double_crochet all around the chain in back loop slip_stitch at the end in the first stitch of the row determine the place of your sleeves proportionally to the amount of chains see illustration + chart below p 5 flatten the circle and mark these stitches with stitch markers for example 23 chain - mark - 10 chain - mark - 23 chain - mark - 10 chain - mark second row chain 2 and treble_crochet yo twice and pull through two three times once you hit a stitch marker treble_crochet once in this stitch chain 1 and treble_crochet once more in this same stitch voilà you just made a raglan increase the increase becomes then visible and gives the project its typical shape at the end of the row slip_stitch in first stitch third row turn your work chain 2 and same process but with double_crochet instead repeat the combo row 2 and 3 in order to form the yoke turn your work for each new row you should get in total 8 10 11 12 14 16 row in total don t hesitate to adjust according to how tight or loose you want your sleeves to be meaning you should be about ten row down in total once there try on the top see if you need to add more increases if the sleeves fit
